At the Court at Whitehall the 24th of November, 1676. By the Kings most excellent Majesty, and the lords of his Majesties most honourable Privy Council. Upon reading this day at the board the humble petition of John Ariens van Hamme, James Barston, Daniel Parker, John Campion, Richard Newnham and divers others using the manual occupation or trade of potters ... England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II) Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685. England and Wales. Privy Council.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
Printed by the assigns of John Bill and Christopher Barker, printers to the Kings most excellent Majesty, London : 1676.
Against the import of painted Earthenware.--Steele. Title from caption title and first lines of text. Steele notation: Arms 91 James that as. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
